Event.name: Publishing
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Publisher</fen> makes a <fen>Work</fen> of an <fen>Author</fen> (or authors) available to some public <fen>Audience</fen> for general enjoyment, examination, and reference. The <fen>Medium</fen> of a <fen>Work</fen> can vary; examples include books, TV programs, movies, and radio shows. Publication normally involves a number of other events, such as editing and advertising of the <fen>Work</fen>, and mass production and sales of a represenation of the <fen>Work</fen>; thus in the most elaborated version of publication, there are a number of other potential roles, such as editor, publicist/advertizer, distributor, printer, etc., but none of these show up as separate, syntactically distinguished roles for the LUs in this frame.
<ex><fex name="Publisher">Doubleday</fex> is <t>publishing</t> <fex name="Work">my newest novel</fex> <fex name="Time">next week</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Author">I</fex> 'm <t>publishing</t> <fex name="Work">my next one</fex> <fex name="Publisher">with Random House</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Publisher
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that acts on behalf of the <fen>Author</fen> to release the <fen>Work</fen> to the public.</def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root>The format utilized by the <fen>Author</fen> to create the <fen>Work</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Work
Arg.definition: <def-root>The creation of the <fen>Author</fen> that is made public by the <fen>Publisher</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The date when the <fen>Work</fen> is available or is expected to be available.</def-root>

Arg.name: Audience
Arg.definition: <def-root>The subset of the population that the <fen>Work</fen> is targeted towards or released to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Author
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person or entity that is responsible for the detailed construction of the content of the <fen>Work</fen>. It is normally expressed in place of the <fen>Publisher</fen> FE, but the <fen>Publisher</fen> may cooccur with <fen>Author</fen>, appearing as an adjunct.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The situation that the <fen>Author</fen> or <fen>Publisher</fen> hopes to bring about by publishing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Publisher</fen> releases the work.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the action that clarifies, in a holistic way, the details of how the publication event unfolded, including comparisons to other events ('the same way') and states of performers of the action that influence the act itself ('peevishly').</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The action taken by the <fen>Author</fen> or <fen>Publisher</fen> that makes the <fen>Work</fen> publicly available.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: appear.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (Of a text) To be prepared for and issued to the public.

lexUnit.name: publish.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make publicly available, us. of printed works.

lexUnit.name: release.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make (a record, song, or movie) publicly available.

lexUnit.name: release [event].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the appearance of a new work.

lexUnit.name: publication.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: making a work (generally a written text) publicly available.
